author: Trudy Allen

comment:
They're trying to allude to JD controlling AH with the phrase "Barefoot & pregnant".  First coined in the early 20th century it only has negative connotations and can't be spun any other way.  

"Barefoot and pregnant" is a figure of speech most commonly associated with the idea that women should not work outside the home and should have many children during their reproductive years. The phrase "barefoot and pregnant" seems to have been introduced in the early twentieth century by the American doctor Arthur E.   

Once again, it's a flimsy accusation when JD has been in relationships, and married, to very independent women with considerably more high profile and successful careers when compared to AH.  Not one of whom has accused him of wanting to keep them at home procreating.
author: Trudy Allen

comment:
I've been saying ever since the "release" of the second audio tape that Johnny's legal team had been doing an outstanding job. I don't know who released any of the info before court. But, Johnny, himself had and continues to be quiet about all of this. He let's his legal team speak FOR him. Probably of his own accord, but with heavy agreement of his legal team as well. I just wonder if the leaks etc of info.....IF those leaks were indeed legal to do.....were not done directly or indirectly by his team. The right type and amount of info to the public at the right time.  Because, we have to be honest....the court of public opinion is always going to play some kind of role. Even if it's not a legal role. He has a teriffic team. I believe they are doing a teriffic job. They are pointing out issues, like all these people being amber's friends etc. But, the issues they have chosen the speak about, how much they dwelled on each issue, what direction they took their questioning in, how johnny answered questions. (NOT: "Yes, that looks like I was being violent." But, "Yes, I was violent towards cupboards, not her". Has been perfect! 
To me letting Johnny admit he can be violent or have a drug and alcohol problem is very important. It shows that he is not perfect. And, even better HE KNOWS he is not perfect. But, also that he took his frustrations out on a bunch of cabinets instead of on amber. 
I think his team is teriffic and (flr once in my life) I feel they will have earned every penny he pays them. Even if he doesn't win here. I can not even fathom him not winning. But, I have also learned that you don't know until you get the verdict. 
The waiting game is killing me though. eek.

comment: I am afraid that the conclusion in the case will be that they both beat eachother. With that verdict The Sun could in fact win ... It is wrong, but technical it would give them right. Just to be clear, as I am concern and believe there might be a possibility  that Johnny on some occasion hit back. Absolutely not to the extend that she describe. But for instance if he'd been drinking and had some drugs and suddenly she would start attacking him, fighting shouting and hitting him, and maybe on such an occasion he would had hit her back, thrown something or pushed her. It would not have been strange, and in my opinion he would have been in his fully right to do so. I don't believe he used his fully strenght or went berserk as she wants it to sound like. But if he  just had enough of her abuse, or had to defending himself. Now I say maybe, I am not quite sure I believe that, but the Judge could very well find it to be that way. And that could make Johnny loosing the case I think. The problem is that people who have not been in close encounter with a pure narcissist ( something very very close to sociopat psycopath, and even borderline on the other end of the scale) they don,'t know what it is like to be dealing with a narcissist. To me Johnny will be completely innocent despite if she draw him to hit back on one or two occassion or if he simply had to defend himself. But we do not have the verdict yet. In my case the verdict took two month to get. But it was a custodycase (but surprisingly similair) and in Sweden. I am not sure about how fast it will be ready in the UK.

author: Mary Turpel

comment:
As an abuse survivor, here is my view:

1.) typically when you get to Johnny Depp‚Äòs age, & you‚Äôve gone through & completed the pains of raising children into adulthood, you don‚Äôt want to have more children. It‚Äôs a part of life people want to experience but when they complete it they typically don‚Äôt want to do it again because of the effort it takes. 

2.) this testimony is just hearsay. This lady is close to Amber heard, has spent lots of time with her leaving her with many opportunities to manipulate her view of Johnny Depp. Unless this woman heard Johnny say it to her, I think it‚Äôs garbage.

3.) When people would ask me about my black eyes, I would never say ‚ÄúI don‚Äôt want to talk about it‚Äú because that‚Äôs like fishing for sympathy to me. It‚Äôs leaving the door open for the person to ask more questions. Myself & most abused women want to shut the conversation down out of fear of being judged for staying & or looking weak which in-turn, protects the abuser. When you finally had enough & want help, you wouldn‚Äôt be vague & lead someone on when they ask if you‚Äôre being abused by saying I don‚Äôt want to talk about it. That is attention seeking behaviour and masochism if it was actually happening. I have never known a woman to admit to abuse, stay in the relationship & openly talk about it to receive the attention. However, I have seen women do this when no abuse is actually taking place. They want the attention but not the abuse but they inflict the abuse on themselves to get the attention.  I‚Äôm not saying her claims are impossible but it seems improbable with all the data collected on abuse survivors.
